experiments_run.name: SA v1 (standard)
experiments_run.notes: Zero improvements found. High acceptance rate (9000+/10000) but no better solutions.

experiments_run.name: SA v2 (aggressive)
experiments_run.notes: Zero improvements. Larger perturbations, multiple restarts, still no improvement.

experiments_run.name: Constructive heuristic
experiments_run.notes: MUCH WORSE than baseline (34-51% worse). Grid-based placement cannot match optimized baseline.

experiments_run.name: Fine-tuning SA
experiments_run.notes: Very small perturbations (0.01 units, 1 degree). Still zero improvements.

experiments_run.name: Exhaustive search
experiments_run.notes: Systematic grid search around each tree. Zero improvements found.

experiments_run.name: Snapshot comparison
experiments_run.notes: Compared all 110 valid snapshots. All have essentially identical scores.

conclusion: The baseline (snapshot 21337353543) is at a TRUE local optimum. No small perturbations can improve it. All available snapshots have the same score. To improve, would need fundamentally different approach (e.g., C++ SA with millions of iterations, or novel algorithm).
